name: Introduction to Mammalogy
description: This course provides an overview of the field of Mammalogy. It covers topics such as taxonomy, anatomy, physiology, behavior, and conservation of mammals.

name: General Zoology
description: This course provides an introduction to the diversity and evolution of animals. It covers topics such as the classification, structure, and development of animals.

name: Animal Ecology
description: This course provides an introduction to the ecology of animals. It covers topics such as population and community ecology, life histories, and behavior.

name: Evolutionary Biology
description: This course provides an introduction to evolutionary biology. It covers topics such as population genetics, natural selection, adaptation, and speciation.

name: Mammalian Anatomy and Physiology
description: This course provides an overview of mammalian anatomy and physiology. It covers topics such as body systems, organ functions, and endocrine regulation.

name: Mammalian Behavior
description: This course provides an overview of the behavior of mammals. It covers topics such as communication, learning, and social organization.

name: Conservation and Management of Mammals
description: This course provides an overview of the conservation and management of mammals. It covers topics such as population dynamics, habitat protection, and population restoration.
